item.title: The great Star !gaunu, which singing named the stars
item.summary: The great star !gãunu, which singing, named the stars. By the position of certain stars, named by !gãunu, the porcupine knows the time for returning home. In the Katkop dialect, by Díä!kwãin (L V.-20. 5576-5580). The star !gaunu named small stars 'aquilae' – they influence the porcupine at dawn and are thus called the Dawn's stars.
item.comments: 1) p.5575v: Dia!kwain's paternal grandfather (!xugen-ddi) told him the stars' stories, 2) See also Stars and flowers and A song sung by the star !gaunu, especially by the Bushman women and !gaunu and Names of stars and Names for the star Canopus and The name of a star in the Katkop dialect: the Hare's star, 3) This story is found in Book V-20
item.author: Dia!kwain (David Hoesar) (V)
